Articles.Content:
Mitsubishi ATD-X

Download

Let me now if there's any improvements that need to be made!

Edited October 2, 2015 by TheLeganderyHero
Added download.

Nice, but it looks more like a F-15...

The ATD-X is my favorite Fifth Generation fighter project apart from the F-22 Raptor.

I suggest that you lower the cockpit a bit, and blend in the engines with a little more spacing.

Edited October 2, 2015 by andrew123

Nice, but it looks more like a F-15...

The ATD-X is my favorite Fifth Generation fighter project apart from the F-22 Raptor.

http://i.imgur.com/Xsb9EF9.jpg

I suggest that you lower the cockpit a bit, and blend in the engines with a little more spacing.

Agreed, it's only the second version as well though. And it's a difficult craft to model (especially that air intake) however the only wing shape that looks similar to that of the ATD-X is the delta wing, and that tends to be to large. They're also pretty similar craft.

How fast is it while under 300 meters?

How stable are the turns?

How fast is it while under 300 meters?

How stable are the turns?

Decently stable, average turning circle. It does however only get up to about 130m/s under 300 meters, even though it should be capable of reaching Mach 1. It's acceleration is pretty terrible as well. Though I can't really predict what your experience with the craft might be, so download it for your self! http://jmp.sh/M7MLjmT

Decently stable, average turning circle. It does however only get up to about 130m/s under 300 meters, even though it should be capable of reaching Mach 1. It's acceleration is pretty terrible as well. Though I can't really predict what your experience with the craft might be, so download it for your self! http://jmp.sh/M7MLjmT

After I finish the SAT on Saturday, finish all of my projects, and study for my tests, I'm making another replica to see which nation made the most KSP compatible stealth fighter craft.

After I finish the SAT on Saturday, finish all of my projects, and study for my tests, I'm making another replica to see which nation made the most KSP compatible stealth fighter craft.

Yeah, great idea. KSP is a bit back to front with it's aerodynamics, especially anything that's beyond or below 90 degrees, so it will definitaly be interesting to see which one performs well. Though I've improved the performance a bit, it's still not viable enough though.

So, I made a J-20 that can reach 380-400 m/s under 100 m, and has extremely good static stability.

I guess the PLAF has the chops for KSP aircraft design.

It's fun to fly.

Not to mention has the ability to make a full loop starting at under 40 m.

Edited October 4, 2015 by andrew123

I guess the PLAF has the chops for KSP aircraft design.

It's fun to fly.

Not to mention has the ability to make a full loop starting at under 40 m.
